definition: to toughen/to temper/to engage in physical exercise/to work out/(fig.) to develop one's skills/to train oneself
variant of 鏈|链[lian4], chain/variant of 煉|炼[lian4]

sentences.english: The exercises should cause exhaustion after the total repetitions are completed.
sentences.chinese: 這種鍛鍊在所有的重複完畢後應該使自己精疲力盡。

sentences.english: Chinese elderly exercise at a public park in Beijing. (March 1, 2011) (Vincent Thian/Associated Press)
sentences.chinese: 北京，老年人在公園鍛鍊。

sentences.english: Becoming a doctor requires years of training there are really no short cuts.
sentences.chinese: 當醫生需要多年的學習和鍛鍊實無捷徑可言。

sentences.english: Why would exercise bulk up your brain?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼鍛鍊會讓大腦增大？

sentences.english: The fresh air and exercise cured him of his headache.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸新鮮空氣和堅持鍛鍊把他的頭痛病治好了。

sentences.english: Of course, exercise and vitamin supplements can't head off all potential risks.
sentences.chinese: 當然，鍛鍊和維生素補充劑不能抵禦所有的潛在風險。

sentences.english: I have friends who, I suspect, secretly scoff at my mild work-out routines.
sentences.chinese: 我疑心有幾個朋友偷偷嘲笑我溫和的鍛鍊程序。

sentences.english: I often go to a gym for a workout.
P90 I want " to " do exercise, but I really do not have the money to pay tuition fees.
sentences.chinese: 我想要做的P90鍛鍊，但我真的沒有錢支付學費。

sentences.english: Every morning I get up at seven I do some exercise and have a light breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 我每天早上七點鐘起牀，鍛鍊一下身體，然後喫早飯。

sentences.english: Making short-films, for directors, is an excellent practice.
sentences.chinese: 短片對於一個導演來說，是一個非常好的鍛鍊。

sentences.english: Aerobic exercise keeps your muscles strong, which can help you maintain mobility as you get older.
sentences.chinese: 有氧運動鍛鍊了肌肉，當你年老時仍能靈活自如。

sentences.english: So it was no wonder that Strippy was so high-strung, lacking freedom and exercise.
sentences.chinese: 失去自由又缺乏鍛鍊，難怪條紋每天都高度緊張。

sentences.english: Difficulties strengthen the mind, an labor does the body.
sentences.chinese: 勞動鍛鍊身體，困難鍛鍊意志。

sentences.english: Difficulties strengthen the mind, an labor does the body.
sentences.chinese: 勞動鍛鍊身體，困難鍛鍊意志。

definition: to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk
to persevere with/to persist in/to insist on
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to be capable of/to be able to/can
